title: Security in CI/CD
description: This is to test your knowledge about security in CI/CD. If you succeed, you will get a bonus flag worth 1 point of Dev, 1 point of Sec and 2 points of Ops. If you're afraid, go check out these nice presentations beforehand... Good luck!

questions.label: Which vulnerability is the most commonly found on the web according to the OWASP top 10?
Which tools can be used to check vulnerable dependencies?
Which tools can be used to perform a static source code analysis?
How can you protect your database regarding access control and data confidentiality?
What does the HTTP header "Content-Security-Policy" do?

choices.label: It enables authentication on the server side
It does not work in Internet Explorer (use "X-Content-Security-Policy")
It restricts domains authorized to load content
It secures data transfers using SSL

questions.label: What does the HTTP header "X-Frame-Options" do?

choices.label: It loads the page in a frame with the given options
It specifies if the browser can load content in a frame/iframe
It does not work in Internet Explorer (use "Frame-Options")

questions.label: What does the HTTP header "Strict-Transport-Security" (aka HSTS) do?

choices.label: It forces the browser to reach the website in HTTPS
It checks that all routers between the client and the server are secured
It does not work in Internet Explorer (use "X-HSTS-Strict")

questions.label: What does "AAA" mean?

choices.label: Ability to Activate Authentication (for a web server)
Attacks Authorized on Authentication (for a cloud provider)

questions.label: Which tool can be used to store and handle access to secrets?
Which tool can be used to automate some types of penetration tests?

successMessage: It seems like you know quite a lot about security in CI/CD! Here is your flag: QUIZ_SECURITYCICD_DEV1_SEC1_OPS2_p093x471u76mfrsfpo8jbvrdfbaf05pfv4oyzl6zy2b4za9f

title: Resiliency
description: We say that a system is resilient when it gracefully handles errors and can recover from failures. How much do you know about resiliency? If you succeed, you will get a bonus flag worth 1 point of Dev and 3 points of Ops. If you need some help, you can start with this documentation. Good luck!

questions.label: What is the Retry pattern?

choices.label: It is a DevOps practice in which the team develops and releases quickly, and tries multiple solutions until it works
It corresponds to the nesting of two "try/catch" blocks to catch exceptions raised by a "finally" block
It is an implementation technique in which remote services calls are retried multiple times to work around temporary unavailability
It is the same as the Bulkhead pattern

questions.label: What is the Circuit Breaker pattern?

choices.label: It is an Agile practice in which a team does not follow traditional validation processes and talk directly with people in another team
It corresponds to the use of a "break" statement in deeply nested "for" loops
It is an implementation technique in which remote service calls are skipped when recent calls to the same service failed
It is the same as the Bulkhead pattern

questions.label: In the Circuit Breaker pattern, what are the possible states of the circuit breaker?
When is a Circuit Breaker better than a Retry pattern?

choices.label: When remote service failures are known to be temporary
When remote service failure are known to be long-lasting
Always: Circuit Breaker is a more advanced version of Retry
Never: Retry is a more advanced version of Circuit Breaker

questions.label: What is the Queue-based Load Leveling pattern?

choices.label: It is a Kanban practice in which a team uses a continuous queue of user stories instead of sprints to smoothen delivery over time
It corresponds to the use of thread-safe queue to transfer data from multiple callers to a single callee in a multi-threaded environment
It is an implementation technique in which a queue is used as an intermediate between callers with variable loads and callees handling requests at a fixed rate
It is the same as the Bulkhead pattern

questions.label: What are the differences between a Rolling update and a Blue/Green deployment?

choices.label: Blue/Green progressively applies the update to the target instances, whereas Rolling Update requires a spare environment to deploy the new version and an ability to switch between the two environments

Rolling Update progressively applies the update to the target instances, whereas Blue/Green requires a spare environment to deploy the new version and an ability to switch between the two environments

questions.label: Blue/Green deployment is used to:

choices.label: Release to production with no downtime nor service interruption
Rollback the production environment to an earlier version
Release a new feature to a small fraction of the users to get feedback
Be more energy-efficient during deployment to preserve the environment
Have more time to deploy to production because users are not impacted

questions.label: What tools or techniques can improve the resiliency of a service?

choices.label: Load balancing between multiple instances with healthchecks and timeouts
Detailed logging (INFO or TRACE level) and monitoring
Apply patterns such as Retry and Circuit Breaker in the code

questions.label: What is the expected maximum downtime (per week) of a service with 99.9% availability?
What is the expected maximum downtime (per week) of a setup with 2 instances of a service with 99.9% availability behind a load balancer (assuming that the load balancer itself is 100% available)?

successMessage: Well done! I hope you apply these techniques every day! Here is your flag: QUIZ_RESILIENCY_DEV1_SEC0_OPS3_7YcKz7zTYtb66LP6385sy5dx4auQWgS9yd9dC2LCK7H4FmX6

title: Docker
description: Have you heard about Docker? Let's prove it! If you are successful, we will give you a flag worth 1 point of Dev and 2 points of Ops. Don't hesitate to read a bit first... Let's go!

questions.label: What is Docker?

choices.label: A tool to run virtual machines
One of the main cloud providers alongside AWS, Azure and GCP
A set of tools to build, ship and run applications

questions.label: On what OS can we run Docker out of the box?
What program/tools belong to the Docker ecosystem?
What kind of software can I run in a container without any hack?

choices.label: A Spring Boot (Java) micro-service running in its own JVM

questions.label: What docker command can be used to download an image and run it in a container?

choices.label: docker container download & docker container run

questions.label: What does the "docker commit" command do?

choices.label: It is a shorthand for executing "git commit" in a container running git
It does not work on Windows
It is an alias for "docker container commit"
It saves a snapshot of the current state of a container as a new Docker image

questions.label: What happens if we store data in a container and restart it?
What happens if we store data in a container, delete it and re-run it?
Because of data loss issues, is it safe to run a database in a container?

choices.label: Yes, if you use docker volumes
Yes, if you backup the host's hard drive regularly
Yes, if you use docker commit and backup the host's hard drive regularly
No, never use containers for databases!

questions.label: Which of these claims about Docker are true?

choices.label: It allows to easily spin multiple instances/versions of the same app
It simplifies the process of making runs reproducible
It makes it easy to run Unix tools on Windows
It slows down the process performance (-30%)
It is the only way to truly embrace the DevOps mindset

successMessage: Go containerize the galaxy! Here is your flag: QUIZ_DOCKER_DEV1_SEC0_OPS2_h2daqbduo3tk1o052d3ehgiy51khhg6po9plq85lh4v9i24r

title: BDD : what is it in reality?
description: BDD is a mindset: it is a way to conceive software development process with higher quality and creating more cohesion between development and business. Have you listened to the talk given by SALMERON Victoria? If you succeed, you will get a bonus flag worth 1 point of Dev. Good luck!

questions.label: Which of the following is not a BDD Maturity level?
Which of the following statements does not apply when you are doing BDD properly?

choices.label: There should not be space for misunderstandings about the Acceptance Criteria (subjective interpretation)
Whoever that is external to the team and to the project should be able to understand a test scenario without having any knowledge about the related product or functionality
You should not document the product behavior more than what is documented in the test scenarios (living documentation, executable specifications)
The effort for automating and maintaining the test scenarios increases along with the time

questions.label: One of the below statements is incorrect if you want to apply BDD in a proper way:

choices.label: Developers and QAs have a common understanding about the Acceptance Criteria

The scenarios behavior is used for coding and test the feature

questions.label: Which of the following statements about BDD is FALSE?

choices.label: It is an extension of TDD (Test Driven Development)
BDD is an approach that consists on defining the behavior of a feature through examples of the use cases involved in that feature
Examples are called Scenarios that are written in natural language and are defined before the development starts, thus, are being used as the Acceptance Tests
Scenarios test the implementation and not the behaviour

questions.label: Which of the following statements about BDD is FALSE?

choices.label: BDD does not bring extra costs and drastically accelerates the development process (less misunderstandings means less bugs and less refactors)
You can apply BDD methodology only if you write scenarios with Gherkin language
Before applying BDD with a high maturity level ensure that you have enough resources to carry it out, otherwise it can become a bottleneck on your development process

questions.label: What is the estimated cost of the Y2K bug fixation?

choices.label: A transfer realized in New-York at 10:00PM could be considered as future transfer
A transfer realized in Tokyo at 10:00PM could crash because considered as past transfer

questions.label: What does the following cron table command : 00 */6 * * *?

choices.label: Run task every odd days at 6AM
Run task every 6hours the second half of the month

questions.label: What does Epoch mean?

choices.label: It's an Emacs family text editor
It's the initial date used by operating systems to mesure time

title: Green IT
description: Êtes-vous conscient de l'impact écologique du numérique ? Êtes-vous prêt à relever le défis ?

questions.label: Parmis ces objets du quotidien, lesquels émettent plus de CO2 pendant leur phase d’usage que pendant leur phase d’extraction de matières premières ?
L’analyse du cycle de vie :

choices.label: Est une méthode d'évaluation normalisée (ISO 14040 et ISO 14044)
Permet de quantifier uniquement l'impact carbone du système étudié
Porte sur l'analyse de sa fabrication
Porte sur l'ensemble de la vie du système étudié : de sa fabrication à sa destruction/recyclage
Permet de dégager des pistes d'éco-conception dans un but d'amélioration du système étudié

questions.label: Quels sont les principaux intérêts d'une éco-conception de logiciel ?

choices.label: Avoir un logiciel accessible pour le plus grand nombre
